Key Match Events: Malik Monk scored 11 of his 31 points in the fourth quarter to help close out the game for the Kings.
Post-Match Reflections: The Kings looked like they are finding their identity as a team that is going to outwork their opponent, which is an absolute joy to watch develop.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Monk had six three-pointers, DeMar DeRozan had four on seven attempts, and Trey Lyles continued his strong play off the bench shooting a perfect 4-for-4 from deep.
Jaylen Wells scored a career-high 30 points on a hyper-efficient 8-of-9, 88.9%, from the field.
The Kings matched, or even exceeded, the Grizzlies' physicality, with several flagrant fouls called in the game.
